Study: Effects of temperature and humidity on the spread of COVID-19: A systematic review.
Study Population: The electronic databases PubMed, Scopus, Web of Science, Cochrane Library, LILACS, OpenGrey and Google Scholar were examined with the searches restricted to the years 2019 and 2020.
Sample Text: Seventeen articles were included in this systematic review, and methodological issues were identified.
Matches:
As with the temperature, the adjustment for confounding factors decreases the impact of humidity on the transmission of COVID-19.

Furthermore, some studies have not evaluated possible confounding factors that could influence the impact of climatic variables on the spread of COVID-19, such as migration patterns, containment measures, general health policies, population density, herd immunity, transportation, and cultural aspects.

Social factors in combination with meteorological factors play a role in coronavirus outbreaks.

The analyses of COVID-19 outbreaks in relation to meteorology aspects reveal significant correlations between the incidence of positive cases and climatic conditions.

Climatic factors influence COVID-19 outbreak as revealed by worldwide mortality
Excerpt: Each additional Celsius degree decreases mortality rate by ~4%, while a 1% increase in relative humidity raises mortality rate by ~2%. Temperature is positively correlated with UV-index, for which one unit of increase results in a ~15% decrease in the mortality rate.
